diagnosticTool.summaryHeading: Here's an overview of your answers

elements.text: Where do most of your sales take place?

optionElements.text: Online
In person
Online and in person

elements.text: How does your business currently use software?

optionElements.resultPageLabel: want to start using software in your business
optionElements.text: We don't use software

optionElements.resultPageLabel: use some software and want more
optionElements.text: We use some software and want more

optionElements.resultPageLabel: already use digital ways of working and are looking for replacements
optionElements.text: All processes are digital. We're looking for replacements

elements.hint: Select ONE ONLY
elements.text: What kind of IT support do you have in place?

optionElements.text: We have someone / an in-house team
We have an external team who support us
We rely on supplier support
We don't have any support in place
Friends / family help when we need it

elements.hint: Select all that apply
elements.text: How do you currently store most of your business information?

optionElements.text: On stickies and in notebooks
On individual computer hard drives
On shared hard drives
On Cloud storage (e.g. iCloud)

steps.title: What you need & want to achieve

elements.text: Do you know which software you need?

optionElements.text: Yes
No

elements.hint: Select all that apply
elements.text: What type of software are you looking for?

optionElements.text: Customer relationship management (CRM)
eCommerce
Digital accounting

optionElements.additionalInfoText: If your software type isn't listed here, please tell us the type of software you're interested in.

steps.title: What you need & want to achieve

elements.hint: Select all that apply
elements.text: Which tasks do you want to simplify?

optionElements.text: Taking payments and listing products for sale
optionElements.hint: Taking payments and listing products for sale

Creating personalised, online customer experiences
Digital tax and accounting

Monitoring sales and promotions
Understanding customer needs and trends
Tracking communication between the team and customers
optionElements.hint: Tracking communication between the team and customers
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: tracking communication between the team and customers

optionElements.text: None of these

steps.title: Your digital journey
steps.summaryTitle: You are most interested in digital adoption that helps you to

elements.hint: Choose all options that you'd like to explore
elements.text2: Which benefits(s) of digital working are you most interested in?

optionElements.text: Finding new business opportunities
Increasing sales
Saving time by automating tasks
Viewing business data in real-time

steps.title: Your digital journey
steps.summaryTitle: The most time-consuming task(s) or area of your business that you'd like to simplify are...

elements.hint: Think about how you/your team work at the moment. What are the most time consuming tasks or parts of the business that you'd like to make easier.
elements.text2: Describe your business' biggest friction point that you'd like to fix.

steps.title: Your digital journey
steps.summaryTitle: Thinking about how your business currently uses software, you said

elements.hint: This could include using email, video calls, accounting software or taking online payments for your goods/services.
elements.text2: To what extent does your business currently use software and digital ways of working?

optionElements.text: We don't use any software at all
We use some software, but would like to use more
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: we use some software and want more

optionElements.text: We use lots of software packages, but are considering alternatives
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: we use lots of software. We're considering replacements

steps.title: Your digital journey
steps.summaryTitle: You currently use the following methods to share or store information...

elements.hint: Think about the job roles in your business and how you store and share your important information.
elements.hint2: Select all the options you use.
elements.text2: How do you / your team currently store and share information?

optionElements.text: In person, sticky notes and emails
optionElements.hint: In person, sticky notes and emails
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: in person, sticky notes and/or emails

optionElements.text: Through a shared database (like a Customer Relationship Management tool)
optionElements.hint: Through a shared database (like a Customer Relationship Management tool)
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: using shared databases like a CRM tool

optionElements.text: Through daily / weekly meetings
Through Word or Excel documents
Something else
optionElements.additionalInfoText: How else do you and your team store and share information?

steps.title: Your digital journey
steps.summaryTitle: Finally, when asked what you considered the biggest benefit to your business would be from digital adoption, you said...

elements.text2: Describe below the benefits you think digital adoption would bring for your business.

elements.hint: Technology could be software like CRM, and/or standard office tools like Excel, email or video calls.
elements.subText: Question1: Do you currently use technology to communicate with customers, suppliers and your team?

optionElements.text: we use technology to manage and track conversations between teams, and suppliers and customers
we use some standard software like email and spreadsheets.
we don't use any technology. Communication takes by phone or face-to-face. We record and store details of conversations on paper.
Finding new business opportunities
optionElements.hint: Is improving how you communicate a business priority?
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: Improving communication with customers and your team

elements.hint: A Server would include in-house or offsite hard drives that can be accessed by you and you team. Cloud relates to virtual storage available through your hardware.
elements.subText: Question 2: Do you use Servers or the Cloud to store your data?

optionElements.text: all our business data is stored in the Cloud or on Servers.
some data is stored in the Cloud or on Servers, but some is kept on individual devices.
we don't use the Cloud or Servers at all.
Is improving data storage a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is improving data storage a business priority?

elements.hint: This may include software that allows you to take payment through your website, or merchants like PayPal. It could also include accounting software that automatically raises invoices for your services.
elements.subText: Question 3: Do you use software to take payments online, or raise and send invoices?

optionElements.text: we use technology to take payments online and generate receipts/raise and send invoices.
we take some digital payments, but also accept cash. Receipts and invoices are created manually.
payments are either by cash or taken by card over the phone. Receipts/invoices are created manually.
Is improving how you take payments a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is improving how you take payments a business priority?

elements.hint: This could be social media, blogging, advertising on other industry websites and/or directory listings.
elements.subText: Question 4: Does your business advertise online?

optionElements.text: we regularly use a range of online marketing tools. It's a big part of our advertising.
we have social media accounts and have advertised in the past, but don't do it regularly.
we don't use online marketing tools.
Is improving your online marketing a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is improving your online marketing a business priority?

elements.hint: This could be a single page that explains what your business does, or a website that hosts a full catalogue of your products services. Customers could find it through a URL unique to your business or through an online marketplace like Etsy.
elements.subText: Question 5: Do you have an online shop front or website that promotes your business?

optionElements.text: we have an online presence we regularly update.
we have an online presence, but the information on it is old and we don't update it.
we don't have an online presence of any sort.
Is creating an online presence a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is creating an online presence a business priority?

elements.hint: For example, software that creates a newsletter or promotional email, and automatically fills in the customer's name for a personal touch.
elements.subText: Question 6: Does your business use software to personalise messages to your customers?

optionElements.text: we use software to personalise all  digital marketing messages.
we use free, web-based tools to personalise some marketing messages, but don't have the software in-house.
we don't use software to personalise our marketing.
Is creating a personalised marketing experience a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is creating a personalised marketing experience a business priority?
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: Create personalised experiences for your customers

elements.hint: These tasks could include: managing appointments; planning an event calendar; monitoring staff holidays; or recording how long it takes to complete a job.
elements.subText: Question 7: Does your business use software to carry out business and task planning?

optionElements.text: we use software for all aspects of business planning and monitoring.
we use software for some areas of the business, but not all.
we don't use software. Planning takes place in meetings and is written down.
Is automating workload and task planning a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is automating workload and task planning a business priority?

elements.hint: This might include training to use software for a day-to-day job, or specialist training such as fire safety or risk assessment.
elements.subText: Question 8: Do you/your team use digital training when they need to learn new skills?

optionElements.text: there's support in place so everyone has access to online learning when they need it.
online training is offered as a cost-effective alternative to on-site training, but is not used as standard.
digital training is not offered.
Is digital training a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is digital training a business priority?

elements.hint: This includes any format of digital sharing, including spreadsheets, email, CRM or via shared documents. If you work alone, think about how you record data should you need to share it in the future.
elements.subText: Question 9: Do you use software to share information with other people in the business?

optionElements.text: there's software in place so information can be stored, shared, accessed and updated across all teams.
information is stored digitally, but sharing is limited and updates need to be recorded manually.
information is shared and stored in hard copy.
Is information sharing a business priority?
optionElements.hint: Is information sharing a business priority?
optionElements.ResultPageLabel: Improve how information is shared in your business
